engines: 3.0L Power Stroke Turbo Diesel V6 (250 hp)
notes: Fourteenth generation F-150 introduced for 2021 model year. Hybrid system pairs electric motor with 3.5L EcoBoost V6. Regular Cab discontinued for consumer models after 2021. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford F-Series article, October 11, 2025 revision.

engines: Dual Permanent Magnet Electric Motors (452 hp standard battery)
Dual Permanent Magnet Electric Motors (580 hp extended battery)
notes: Battery electric version of F-150 with up to 320 mile range. High-voltage system (400V/800V switchable) demands EV-certified technicians. Only available in SuperCrew body style. Production began 2022 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford F-150 Lightning article, October 11, 2025 revision.

High-performance off-road variant of F-150 with specialized suspension and 37-inch tires. Features advanced traction control systems. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford F-Series article, October 11, 2025 revision.

Compact pickup truck on C2 platform. Hybrid variant uses parallel hybrid system with 1.1kWh lithium-ion battery. AWD only available with EcoBoost engine until 2025 refresh. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Maverick (2022) article, October 11, 2025 revision.

Mid-size SUV with removable top and doors. Features G.O.A.T. (Goes Over Any Type) terrain management system with multiple drive modes. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Bronco article, October 11, 2025 revision.

Compact crossover SUV on Ford C2 platform. AWD system with selectable terrain modes. Badlands trim features rear differential locker. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Bronco Sport article, October 11, 2025 revision.

engines: Extended Range Battery (286 hp rear motor, 346 hp all-wheel drive)
notes: Battery electric crossover SUV. Uses 68-98 kWh battery packs. GT variant features dual electric motors producing 480 hp. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Mustang Mach-E article, October 11, 2025 revision.
Mid-size SUV on Ford CD6 platform. Hybrid variant uses 3.3L V6 with electric motor. ST performance variant uses 3.0L V6. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Explorer article, October 11, 2025 revision.

Fourth generation compact crossover SUV on Ford C2 platform. Introduced as 2020 model year. Hybrid variant uses 2.5L Atkinson-cycle I4 with electric motor. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Escape article, October 11, 2025 revision.
Mid-size crossover SUV on Ford CD5 platform. AWD system standard on higher trims. Discontinued after 2024 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Edge article, October 11, 2025 revision.
Full-size SUV on Ford T3 platform. Features advanced towing capabilities up to 9,300 lbs. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Expedition article, October 11, 2025 revision.

engines: 5.2L V8 Flat Plane Crank (500 hp - Shelby GT500)
notes: Sports car with both S550 (2015-2023) and S650 (2024-present) generations in 2020s. GT500 variant features supercharged V8. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Mustang article, October 11, 2025 revision.

engines: 3.0L Power Stroke Turbo Diesel I6 (210 hp)
notes: Mid-size pickup truck based on T6 platform. Diesel variant uses 3.0L I6 turbo diesel engine. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Ranger (T6) article, October 11, 2025 revision.

engines: 3.7L Power Stroke Turbo Diesel I6 (190 hp)
notes: Commercial van series with multiple configurations. Third generation with 2020 facelift. Diesel variant uses 3.7L I6 turbo diesel. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Transit article, October 11, 2025 revision.
